channel.title: Comments on: That Sneaky, Sneaky, Sneak Thief!

item.title: By: Sabrina Truscott
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Truscott
item.description: Great, Moira! Glad to know it's resonating with you. :)
item.content:encoded: Great, Moira! Glad to know it’s resonating with you. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Diane
item.dc:creator: Diane
item.description: Thanks for the insights, I notice when I go to watch tv , which is very seldom , I find myself uncomfortable and will fix things around , I am always trying to declutter but just don't look so.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the insights, I notice when I go to watch tv , which is very seldom , I find myself uncomfortable and will fix things around , I am always trying to declutter but just don’t look so.

item.title: By: Moira
item.dc:creator: Moira
item.description: It all make sense Sabrina, great lesson to learn from. Thank you.
item.content:encoded: It all make sense Sabrina, great lesson to learn from. Thank you.

item.title: By: Sabrina Truscott
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Truscott
item.description: Disaster piles! LOL. It's insidious isn't it? Just remember, bite size chunks. Don't stress, Virginia. And maybe re-frame from disaster piles to "treasure hunt piles." You never know what they're going to open up for you ;)
item.content:encoded: Disaster piles! LOL. It’s insidious isn’t it? Just remember, bite size chunks. Don’t stress, Virginia. And maybe re-frame from disaster piles to “treasure hunt piles.” You never know what they’re going to open up for you ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Virginia Reeves
item.dc:creator: Virginia Reeves
item.description: Oh my - are you peeking at my paperwork disaster piles? (grin) I start and let myself get distracted by doing a more 'enjoyable' project (which can be anything) rather than clean up. Thanks for the reminder to de-clutter. I'm putting off bigger projects by stating "I have to do this clean up" but not doing it.
item.content:encoded:
Oh my – are you peeking at my paperwork disaster piles? (grin)
I start and let myself get distracted by doing a more ‘enjoyable’ project (which can be anything) rather than clean up.
Thanks for the reminder to de-clutter.
I’m putting off bigger projects by stating “I have to do this clean up” but not doing it.

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Very true if there is no room for clutter then the mind can absorb, but if clutter exists then there is no room for improvement and even if that improvement does rear its head, it is not as full as one would like as the clutter stops it
item.content:encoded: Very true if there is no room for clutter then the mind can absorb, but if clutter exists then there is no room for improvement and even if that improvement does rear its head, it is not as full as one would like as the clutter stops it
